metadata.title: YouTube Analytics Metrics Guide 2025: Every Metric Explained
metadata.description: Understand every YouTube analytics metric. What they mean and how to improve them.

hero.headline: YouTube Analytics Metrics Guide
hero.subheadline: Know your numbers. Understand every metric that matters.

sections.content: YouTube Analytics contains dozens of metrics—but which ones actually matter? Understanding what each metric measures and how they connect helps you make better content decisions. Here's a guide to every important metric and what it really tells you.

sections.title: Metric Interpretation Tips
content: Compare to YOUR averages, not others

faq.question: Most important YouTube metric?
faq.answer: Watch time—YouTube's stated priority. But CTR and retention together matter most for recommendations. High CTR with low retention hurts you. Moderate CTR with great retention wins long-term.

faq.question: What's a good CTR?
faq.answer: Channel-dependent, but 4-10% typical for most. Higher on subscribers' feeds, lower on Browse. Compare to your own averages. 2% on Browse can still drive millions of views with volume.

faq.question: RPM vs CPM—what's the difference?
faq.answer: CPM is what advertisers pay YouTube per 1000 impressions. RPM is what YOU receive per 1000 views after YouTube's 45% cut and non-monetized views factored. RPM is your actual revenue metric.

faq.question: Why do metrics fluctuate?
faq.answer: Normal—audience behavior varies by day, season, and content. New videos take time to stabilize. YouTube experiments with recommending to different audiences. Focus on trends over weeks, not days.
